Replace.Text: +1 [ICON_Food] Food to [ICON_Resource_Bananas] Bananas and [ICON_Resource_Deer] Deer resources in this city.
[ICON_CITIZEN] Population growth of this city is increased by 50%.
Hospital
[ICON_CITIZEN] Population growth of this city is increased by 50%.
Medical Lab

[ICON_CITIZEN] Population growth of this city is increased by 50%, with an additional +50% when [ICON_Power] Powered. Its base [ICON_Food] Food bonus is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles that do not already have a bonus from this building type.
+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each specialty district in this city.

+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each specialty district in this city. Holds [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Works of Art. May not be built in a Theater Square district that already has an Archaeological Museum.
+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each specialty district in this city. Holds [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts. May not be built in a Theater Square district that already has an Art Museum.
Opera House
+33% [ICON_Culture] Culture to this city.

+33% [ICON_Culture] Culture to this city. Additional +34% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture when [ICON_Power] Powered. Its bonus [ICON_Culture] Culture when [ICON_Power] Powered is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles. This bonus applies once to a city, and multiple copies of this building within 6 tiles of a city center do not provide additional bonuses.
+0.5 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science per [ICON_Citizen] Citizen in this city.
+33% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science to this city.
Public School
{LOC_BUILDING_LIBRARY_DESCRIPTION_SST}

+33% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science to this city. Additional +34% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science when [ICON_Power] Powered. Its bonus [ICON_SCIENCE] Science when [ICON_Power] Powered is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles. This bonus applies once to a city, and multiple copies of this building within 6 tiles of a city center do not provide additional bonuses.

+25% combat experience for all cavalry and siege class units trained in this city. +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to Pastures in this city.[NEWLINE]Strategic Resource Stockpiles increased by +10 (on Standard Speed).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be built in an Encampment district that already has a Barracks.
{LOC_BUILDING_BANK_DESCRIPTION_SST}{LOC_BUILDING_MARKET_EXPANSION1_DESCRIPTION}
+25% [ICON_Gold] Gold to this city.

+25% [ICON_Gold] Gold to this city. Additional +25% [ICON_GOLD] Gold when [ICON_Power] Powered. Its bonus [ICON_GOLD] Gold when [ICON_Power] Powered is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles. This bonus applies once to a city, and multiple copies of this building within 6 tiles of a city center do not provide additional bonuses.
+10% [ICON_Production] Production to this city.
+15% [ICON_Production] Production to this city when [ICON_Power] Powered.
{LOC_PRODUCTION_10_SST} +1 [ICON_Production] Production to [ICON_Resource_Stone] Stone and [ICON_Resource_Copper] Copper resources in this city.

+10% [ICON_Production] Production in this city. Additional +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when [ICON_Power] Powered. Its bonus [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when [ICON_Power] Powered is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles. This bonus applies once to a city, and multiple copies of this building within 6 tiles of a city center do not provide additional bonuses.
{LOC_BUILDING_POWER_PLANT_EXPANSION2_DESCRIPTION}
{LOC_BUILDING_COAL_POWER_PLANT_DESCRIPTION}
{LOC_BUILDING_FOSSIL_FUEL_POWER_PLANT_DESCRIPTION}
Manufacturing Plant

{LOC_PRODUCTION_15_SST} +50% [ICON_Production] Production towards city projects in this city. Its bonus [ICON_Production] Production when [ICON_Power] Powered is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles. This bonus applies once to a city, and multiple copies of this building within 6 tiles of a city center do not provide additional bonuses.

+25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food on all Coast tiles for this city. +1 [ICON_FOOD] to [ICON_RESOURCE_FISH] Fish and [ICON_RESOURCE_CRABS] Crabs in this city. +2 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing if this city is adjacent to the coast. +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity, if this city does not yet have a Market building.

+25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city. Bonus [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production equal to the adjacency bonus of the Harbor district. +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to all Coast and Lake tiles in this city.

+25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city. Allows Fleets and Armadas to be trained directly. Fleet and Armada training costs reduced 25%. +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to all Coast tiles in this city.

Bonus [ICON_Amenities] Amenities extend to each city center within 9 tiles. This bonus applies once to a city, and multiple copies of this building within 9 tiles of a city center do not provide additional bonuses. +5 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism for each Wonder built on or adjacent to a Coast tile in this city.

Bonus [ICON_Amenities] Amenities extend to each city center within 6 tiles. This bonus applies once to a city, and multiple copies of this building within 6 tiles of a city center do not provide additional bonuses. +10 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism if the city population is 10 or higher and +10 additional [ICON_Tourism] Tourism if the city population is 20 or higher.
+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] to all tiles adjacent to a river that are within 6 tiles. City Centers within 6 tiles receive +6 [ICON_Power] Power from renewable water sources.
+50% [ICON_Tourism] to this city's Great Works, Wonders, Improvements, and National Parks. +25% combat experience for air units trained in this city. +1 air unit slot in Aerodrome district.

+50% [ICON_Tourism] to this city's Great Works, Wonders, Improvements, and National Parks. +50% combat experience for air units trained in this city. +1 air unit slot in Aerodrome district. Allows the ability to airlift land units between Aerodrome districts with Airports after the Rapid Deployment civic is unlocked.
+4 [ICON_Food] Food for each Neighborhood in this city. Can only be built once in a city, even if the city has multiple Neighborhoods.

+4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each Neighborhood in this city. Additional +4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold when [ICON_Power] Powered. +4 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism. +10 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism if the city's [ICON_Citizen] Population is 10 or higher; +20 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism if the city's [ICON_Citizen] Population is 20 or higher; Can only be built once in a city, even if the city has multiple Neighborhoods.

A building unique to Japan. +10% [ICON_Production] Production in this city. Additional +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when [ICON_Power] Powered. Provides +4 [ICON_Culture] Culture to this city after researching the Electricity technology. Its [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production bonus is extended to all City Centers within 6 tiles that do not already have a bonus from this building type.
A building unique to America. +100% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism pressure from this city towards other civilizations when the game enters the Modern era. {LOC_BUILDING_BROADCAST_CENTER_DESCRIPTION_SST}

A building unique to the Ottomans. {LOC_BUILDING_BANK_DESCRIPTION_SST} Accumulate 1 extra Strategic resource for every different type of Strategic resource this city has improved. Receive 1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity for every Luxury resource this city has improved.
A building unique to Arabia. {LOC_BUILDING_UNIVERSITY_DESCRIPTION_SST} Bonus [ICON_FAITH] Faith equal to the adjacency bonus of the Campus district.

A building unique to the Māori. {LOC_BUILDING_AMPHITHEATER_DESCRIPTION_SST} +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_FAITH] Faith to all of this city's tiles with a passable feature or natural wonder. After Flight is researched receive +1 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism to all of this city's tiles with a feature or natural wonder. Costs no maintenance. Has no Great Work slots.

A building unique to Portugal. {LOC_BUILDING_UNIVERSITY_DESCRIPTION_SST} +25% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards naval units in this city. +1 [ICON_SCiENCE] Science for every two coast or lake tiles in this city. +1 [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admiral and +1 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist point per turn.

A building unique to Poland. {LOC_BUILDING_BANK_DESCRIPTION_SST} International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from this city gain +3 [ICON_Production] Production; domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes gain +6 [ICON_Gold] Gold. +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity, if this city does not yet have a Lighthouse building.

A building unique to Hungary. +3 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities and +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production extends to each city center within 6 tiles. These bonuses apply once to a city, and multiple copies of this building within 6 tiles of a city center do not provide additional bonuses. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This city receives +3 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism and +2 additional [ICON_Amenities] Amenities if there is at least one Geothermal Fissure in this city's borders.

A building unique to the Aztecs. Provides 2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities, +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, and a [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General Point. Provides +1 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after advancing to the Conservation Civic.
A building unique to Khmer. Replaces the Temple. Required to purchase Apostles and Inquisitors with [ICON_Faith] Faith. +0.5 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every [ICON_CITIZEN] population in this city.
{LOC_BUILDING_PRASAT_EXPANSION2_DESCRIPTION} Recalling Heroes in this city costs 15% less [ICON_Faith] Faith.

One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Volcano and provides +3 [ICON_Food] Food to adjacent tiles. On eruption it gives low yields and is most likely to damage improvements and buildings. Infrequently erupts, but is always active.
Four tile natural wonder. Provides +3 [ICON_Food] Food, +1 [ICON_Production] Production, and +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. Naval combat units that enter adjacent plots are granted their next promotion. Adjacent plots yield +1 [ICON_Production] Production.
Two tile impassable natural wonder. Land combat units that enter adjacent plots receive the ability 'Spear of Fionn' (+5 combat strength). Adjacent plots yield +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Four tile natural wonder. It provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food, +3 [ICON_Production] Production, and +1 [ICON_Science] Science.
One tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +5 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +3 [ICON_Science] Science, and Fresh Water.

Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +4 [ICON_Culture] Culture. Units heal completely if they heal for one turn adjacent to the Dead Sea. Does not provide Fresh Water.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_Production] Production and +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to adjacent tiles.

Three tile natural wonder. Provides +4 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science. After the game reaches the Industrial Era it provides an additional +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science.
Three tile natural wonder. It provides +4 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_Production] Production.
Two tile natural wonder that can be found on coastal terrain and provides +4 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Science] Science. Major adjacency bonus to the Campus district.

Two tile natural wonder that can be found on coastal terrain and provides +3 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. +15 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending in this tile.
Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. Does not provide Fresh Water.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production to adjacent tiles.

One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture to adjacent tiles. Land combat units who move next to the Matterhorn ignore Hills for the rest of the game and gain +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in hills.

One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Volcano and provides +2 [ICON_Production] Production to adjacent tiles. On Eruption it gives high yields to adjacent tiles, but large [ICON_Citizen] Population loss. It is always active.

Three-tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles. The city that owns the tile receives +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold on its outgoing international [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.

Two tile impassable natural wonder. +2 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenities. It provides an additional [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity if adjacent to an Entertainment Complex. Major adjacency bonus to Theater Square, Campus, and Commercial Hub districts. Standard adjacency bonus to the Holy Site district. It provides Fresh Water.
Four tile natural wonder. It provides +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, and +4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Science] Science to adjacent tiles.
Four tile natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith, +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.

Three tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles. Provides 2 [ICON_GREATGENERAL] Great General points and 2 [ICON_GREATMERCHANT] Great Merchant points if you own at least one of these tiles.
Receive the [ICON_RESOURCE_CINNAMON] Cinnamon and [ICON_RESOURCE_CLOVES] Cloves Luxury resources. These cannot be earned any other way in the game, and provide 4 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities each.
Land melee units' attacks do full damage to the city's Walls.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to foreign cities earn +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each Luxury resource at the destination.
Your Builders can now make Monastery improvements.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_MONASTERY_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Monastery.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_MONASTERY_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}

+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith. +15 HP healing for friendly religious unit on this tile that has not attacked this turn. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every two adjacent districts, and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for each adjacent Luxury Resource. +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing. Gain an additional 1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing when the Colonialism civic is discovered. Cannot be built next to another Monastery.
Shallow water tiles you own provide +1 [ICON_Production] Production in cities with an Industrial Zone. Additional +1 after researching Industrial era or later technologies or civics.
Your cities get +15% [ICON_Production] Production towards buildings and wonders.
Your Builders can now make Batey improvements.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_BATEY_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Batey.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_BATEY_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}

+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every adjacent Bonus Resource and Entertainment Complex (increased to +2 [Icon_Culture] Culture when Exploration is discovered). Provides [Icon_Tourism] Tourism after researching Flight. Cannot be built adjacent to another Batey or on Hills.
Your Builders can now make Cahokia Mounds improvements.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_MOUND_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Cahokia Mounds.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_MOUND_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}

+3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Cities receive +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity from their first Cahokia Mound improvement. Upon discovering Colonialism, cities receive +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity from their second Cahokia Mound improvement. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every 2 adjacent Districts once Feudalism is discovered or for every adjacent District once Replaceable Parts is researched. Provides +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing. Receive an additional [ICON_HOUSING] Housing once Cultural Heritage is discovered. Cannot be built adjacent to other Cahokia Mounds.
Cities receive +2 [ICON_Power] Power and +2 [ICON_Production] Production for every Harbor building.
International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes receive +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith for every district in this city.
When you use a religious unit to convert a city for the first time earn 30 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science per [ICON_Citizen] Population of that city (on Standard Speed).
Your cities get +30% [ICON_Production] Production towards city projects.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes generate +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every 3 tiles they travel.
Your [ICON_TradingPost] Trading Posts in foreign cities provide +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold to your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes passing through or going to the city.
Your cities with Holy Sites exert 100% stronger religious pressure to adjacent cities.
Cities with an Industrial Zone receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production for every improved resource type. After researching Industrialization it becomes +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to any city-state provide +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every specialty district in the origin city.
Your Builders can now make Colossal Head improvements.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_COLOSSAL_HEAD_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Colossal Head.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_COLOSSAL_HEAD_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}

+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every 2 adjacent Rainforest or every 2 adjacent Woods (increased to every Rainforest or every Woods once Humanism civic is discovered). Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from [ICON_CULTURE] Culture after researching Flight. Cannot be built on Snow or Snow Hills.
+2 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity.
+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity in cities with a Commercial Hub district. Additional +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity in cities with a Bank.
Your Builders can now make Mahavihara improvements.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_MAHAVIHARA_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Mahavihara.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_MAHAVIHARA_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}

+1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +1 [Icon_Housing] Housing. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for every adjacent Holy Site district and +1 [ICON_Science] Science for every adjacent Campus district. After researching Scientific Theory receive an additional +1 [Icon_Science] Science for every adjacent Campus. When a player constructs their first Mahavihara receive a random technology. Must be built on flat terrain not adjacent to another Mahavihara.
Your districts on or next to Coast or Lake tiles provide +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
Your Builders can now make Nazca Line improvements.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_NAZCA_LINE_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Nazca Line.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_NAZCA_LINE_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}

+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Food] Food to adjacent tiles. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Food] Food to adjacent tiles with a resource. +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to adjacent flat tiles after researching Mass Production. +1 Appeal. Can only be built on flat Desert. This tile cannot be worked.
Land combat or Support units are 15% cheaper to purchase with [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each Encampment district building in that city.
Cities with a Campus district receive 15% higher city growth rate and +1 [ICON_Food] Food to Farms.
Your light and heavy cavalry units have +5 [ICON_Strength] Strength when fighting on hill tiles.
Your Builders can now make Trading Dome improvements.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_TRADING_DOME_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Trading Dome.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_TRADING_DOME_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}

+4 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. +1 [ICON_Science] Science wiht Economics. +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every adjacent Luxury resource. Your outgoing international [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes grant +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold per Trading Dome at the origin. Cannot be built next to another Trading Dome.
Your Builders can now make Moai improvements.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_MOAI_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Moai.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_IMPROVEMENT_MOAI_SHARED_DESCRIPTION}

+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every 2 adjacent Moai. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if on or adjacent to a Volcanic Soil tile. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if adjacent to a Coast or Lake tile. Additional [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism as you advance through the Civics and Technology Tree. Can be built on Plains, Plains Hills, Grassland, Grassland Hills, or Volcanic Soil. Cannot be placed adjacent to a Woods or Rainforest tile.
Your cities receive +3 [ICON_Production] Production for each foreign civilization they have a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route to.

+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith from [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Great Works of Writing and [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Works of Art. Cities with a Holy Site receive +1 [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer and [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist point per turn.

Receive [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points when a land unit defeats a major or minor civilization's unit and receive [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admiral points when a naval unit defeats a major or minor civilization's unit equal to 25% of the opposing unit's strength (Standard Speed). +2 [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points and [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Great Admiral points per turn.

Breathtaking tiles adjacent to either a Natural Wonder or a Mountain receive +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science. Breathtaking tiles adjacent to either a Wonder or Woods receive +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. All tiles in a city with a National Park are +2 Appeal. Cities founded on Breathtaking tiles receive a free Naturalist.

Units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength on their home continent. The first [ICON_Envoy] Envoy you send to each city-state counts as two [ICON_Envoy] Envoys. Envoys sent to City-States you have a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route to count as two [ICON_Envoy] Envoys. Gain the Rough Rider unique unit with Rifling.

Applies free [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People points equal to the base [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person cost of the current game era towards recruiting Great People. After recruiting or patronizing a [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person, 20% of its [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person point cost is refunded.

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to your own cities provide +4 Loyalty per turn for the starting city. [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to foreign cities or from foreign cities provide +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture to you. Additional +4 [ICON_Culture] Culture for [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to an Ally's city or vassal city-state.

All cities receive +2 [ICON_Production] Production when constructing Buildings and Wonders. Gain [ICON_CULTURE] Culture equal to 25% of the construction cost when finishing Buildings and 50% when completing Wonders.
+5% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in Cities for every Industrial Zone building in that city. +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to all improved Strategic Resources.

Great Works in Eleanor’s cities each cause -2 Loyalty per turn in foreign cities within 9 tiles. A city that leaves another civilization due to a loss of Loyalty and is currently receiving the most Loyalty per turn from Eleanor's civilization skips the Free City step to join this civilization.
Receive +1 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for each adjacent unit (King of the Eburones)

Your civilization gains [ICON_CULTURE] Culture equal to 20% of the unit’s cost when a non-civilian is trained. Melee, Anti-Cavalry, and Ranged Units receive +1 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for every adjacent unit.

Your civilization gains [ICON_FAITH] Faith equal to 40% of the unit’s cost when a non-civilian is trained. Combat victories provide [ICON_FAITH] Faith equal to 50% of the Combat Strength of the defeated unit (on Standard Speed). Each [ICON_ENVOY] Envoy you send to a city-state of your majority Religion counts as two [ICON_ENVOY] Envoys. (Must have a majority Religion).

Levied units gain an ability giving them +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement and +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. It costs 50% less [ICON_GOLD] Gold and resources to upgrade Levied units. If you Levy troops from a City-State receive 2 [ICON_ENVOY] Envoys with that City-State. Gain the Black Army unique unit when the Castles technology is researched.

Naval units can be purchased with [ICON_FAITH] Faith. Religious units pay no movement to embark or disembark. +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith and +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture to City Centers that are adjacent to Coast or Lake tiles.
Holy Sites are granted [ICON_FOOD] Food equal to its adjacency bonus and +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing if on a River. Holy Sites trigger a Culture Bomb.

May not build Holy Site districts. Gains all Beliefs of any Religion that has established itself in a majority of his cities. Receives an Apostle each time he finishes a M'banza or Theater Square district (of that city's majority Religion).

[ICON_Governor] Governors established in a city provides +3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, as well as +3% [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Science] Science for each Promotion they have earned, including their first.

It costs 50% less [ICON_GOLD] Gold to recruit Great People and the Market gains 2 [ICON_GreatWork_WRITING] Great Writing slots in Cities founded by Mali. Commercial Hubs provide +1 [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer point per turn. [ICON_GreatWork_WRITING] Great Works of Writing receive +6 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and +3 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
+20% [ICON_Production] Production towards all districts and buildings, rising to +40% if there is a Nubian Pyramid adjacent to the City Center.

+15% of all yields when in a [ICON_GLORY_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age or Heroic Age. +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when not in a [ICON_GLORY_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age or Heroic Age against Civilizations who are also not in a [ICON_GLORY_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age or Heroic Age.

Can move their original [ICON_Capital] Capital to any city with a Cothon they founded by completing a unique project in that city. +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity for each Government Plaza building and the Government Plaza district. +50% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards the Government Plaza. +50% [ICON_Production] Production toward districts and buildings in the city with the Government Plaza.

The Religion founded by Poland becomes the majority in an adjacent city that loses a tile to a Polish Culture Bomb. Holy Sites gain standard [ICON_FAITH] Faith adjacency bonus from adjacent districts. Palace provides +3 [ICON_FAITH] Faith. All [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relics provide bonus Faith (+2), Culture (+2) and Gold (+4).

The Religion founded by Poland becomes the majority in an adjacent city that loses a tile to a Polish Culture Bomb. Holy Sites gain standard [ICON_FAITH] Faith adjacency bonus from adjacent districts. Palace provides +3 [ICON_FAITH] Faith. All [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relics and [ICON_GreatWork_HeroRelic] Heroic Relics provide +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold.

+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Science] Science from international [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. Receives [ICON_Science] Science or [ICON_Culture] Culture from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to civilizations that are more advanced than Russia. +1 per technology or civic ahead.

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +2 [ICON_Production] Production for Egypt. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Egypt provide +3 [ICON_Food] Food for them, +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Science] Science for Egypt. Trading with Allies earns twice as many bonus Alliance Points.

+20% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to cities founded by you. -20% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to cities not founded by you. Can declare a War of Liberation after gaining the Defensive Tactics Civic. +100% [ICON_Production] Production and +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for the first 10 turns after declaring a War of Liberation.
Resources on Floodplains receive +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. Owned Floodplains tiles grant +1 Appeal to adjacent tiles instead of usual -1.
Spend Builder charges to complete 50% of the original district cost.
[ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas provide all of the [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for technologies. -80% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science per turn.

Units receive +2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength or [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength for each Holy City converted to Byzantium's Religion (including Byzantium's Holy City). Byzantium's Religion is spread to nearby cities when defeating a unit belonging to an enemy civilization or city-state. +1 [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet point from cities with a Holy Site district.

All Cities receive Projects where they can convert 50% of their [Icon_Production] Production into [Icon_Food] Food, [Icon_Faith] Faith, or 100% if it is [Icon_GOLD] Gold. Cities with 10 or more Population receive +1 [Icon_Gold] Gold, +0.5 [Icon_Science] Science, and +0.5 [Icon_Culture] Culture per turn for each Population in the city.

All offensive Spies operate at 1 level higher. Whenever an offensive spy mission is successful, you also gain 400% of the [ICON_Faith] Faith, [ICON_Culture] Culture, and [ICON_SCIENCE] Science that the targeted city earned that turn. Receive a free spy (and extra spy capacity) after discovering Defensive Tactics. Can purchase Spies with [ICON_Faith] Faith.
+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to all units after discovering the Military Training civic. Promoting a unit does not end that unit’s turn.

Cities with an Aqueduct receive +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity from entertainment and +0.5 [ICON_FAITH] Faith for every [ICON_CITIZEN] population. Farms provide +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food if adjacent to an Aqueduct and +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith if adjacent to a Holy Site.

May not gain Great Prophets or found Religions. +2 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Production] Production, +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, and +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic, [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifact, and Sculpture [ICON_GreatWork_Sculpture] Great Work of Art in addition to the usual [ICON_Culture] Culture. Receive 50% more [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist, [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician, and [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant points. Palace has slots for 5 Great Works.

Happy cities receive an additional +10% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. Happy cities generate +1 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist point per Campus and +1 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer point per Industrial Zone. Ecstatic cities double all these amounts.

May form Fleets and Armadas with Mercantilism, instead of Nationalism and Mobilization. [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes receive +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, and +1 [ICON_Production] Production. [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes between multiple continents receive triple these numbers. Cities not on your original Capital’s continent receive a builder when founded.

+3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for units fighting in Rainforest, Marsh, or Woods tiles. +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement if they begin their turn there. Both these bonuses are doubled if the tile is your territory.
{LOC_TRAIT_LEADER_TRIEU_DESCRIPTION}

All land specialty districts can only be built on Rainforest, Marsh, or Woods. These districts and each of their buildings receive the following yields on these features: +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in Woods, +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science in Rainforest and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in Marsh. Woods can be planted with the Medieval Faires civic.

+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each specialty district while in the Medieval to Industrial eras. +20% [ICON_Production] Production toward Medieval, Renaissance, and Industrial era wonders. [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from wonders of any era is +100%.

Sweden gains 50 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor when earning a Great Person (on Standard Speed). Sweden receives +2 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer point from Factories and +2 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist point from Universities. Having Sweden in the game adds three unique World Congress competitions starting in the Industrial Era.

Settling adjacent to Fresh Water and Coast does not provide extra [ICON_HOUSING] Housing, instead each Farm provides an additional +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity for every Luxury resource adjacent to the City Center.

Cities within 6 tiles of the [ICON_Capital] Capital gain +10% to all yields and when founded receive a builder. Other cities receive -15% to all yields. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength to units within 6 tiles of the [ICON_Capital] Capital.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Château, unique to France.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold. +1 Appeal. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every adjacent wonder (becomes +2 after researching Flight). +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold if on a tile containing a River edge. Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from [ICON_CULTURE] Culture after researching Flight. Cannot be built adjacent to another Château.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Mekewap, unique to Cree.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing. +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold if adjacent to a Luxury resource. For every adjacent Bonus Resource +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food. Additional [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, [ICON_FOOD] Food, and [ICON_HOUSING] Housing as you advance through the Civics and Technology Tree. Must be placed adjacent to a Bonus or Luxury resource. Cannot be built adjacent to another Mekewap.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Polder, unique to Netherlands.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +1 [ICON_Production] Production, and +0.5 [ICON_Housing] Housing. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food if adjacent to a Polder improvement. Additional [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and [ICON_FOOD] Food as you advance through the Civics and Technology Tree. Must be placed on a Coast or Lake tile adjacent to 3 or more passable land tiles. Increases [ICON_Movement] Movement Cost of tile to 3.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Ziggurat, unique to Sumeria.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Science] Science. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if next to River. Additional [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_Science] Science once Civil Engineering is discovered. Cannot be built on Hills but may be built on Floodplains. Cannot be built adjacent to another Ziggurat.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Sphinx, unique to Egypt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +2 Appeal. +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith if next to a wonder. +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if built on Floodplains. Additional [ICON_CULTURE] Culture once Humanism is discovered. Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after researching Flight. Cannot be built next to another Sphinx. Cannot be built on Snow or Snow Hills.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Terrace Farm, unique to the Inca.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food. Provides +0.5 Housing [ICON_Housing] Housing. +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for each adjacent Mountain Tile. Gain +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production if adjacent to Fresh Water and for each adjacent Aqueduct district. Additional [ICON_FOOD] Food as you advance through the Civics and Technology Tree for adjacency with other Terrace Farms. Can be placed on Grassland Hills, Plains Hills, and Desert Hills.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Stepwell, unique to India.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for each adjacent Holy Site district. +1 [ICON_Food] Food for each adjacent Farm. Additional [ICON_Housing] Housing, [ICON_Faith] Faith, and [ICON_Food] Food as you advance through the Technology and Civics Tree. Prevents [ICON_Food] Food loss during Drought. Cannot be built on Hills or adjacent to another Stepwell.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Hacienda, unique to Gran Colombia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and +0.5 [Icon_Housing] Housing. +1 [ICON_Food] Food for each adjacent Plantation. Plantations and Haciendas receive +1 [ICON_Production] Production for every two adjacent Haciendas (increased to every Hacienda with Rapid Deployment). Can only be built on Plains, Plains Hills, Grassland, and Grassland Hills.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Kampung, unique to Indonesia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing. +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food for each adjacent Fishing Boat. Additional [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_Housing] Housing, and [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism as you advance through the Technology and Civics Tree. Must be placed on a Coast or Lake tile adjacent to a sea resource.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Nubian Pyramid, unique to Nubia. Must be built on Desert, Desert Hills or Desert Floodplains. +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Food] Food. Receives additional yields from adjacent districts. +1 [ICON_Food] Food if adjacent to a City Center, Dam, Canal, or Aqueduct. +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each adjacent Entertainment Complex or Water Park. Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after researching Flight. For all other districts that award adjacency bonuses: +1 of the appropriate yield if that district is adjacent.

Unlocks the Nau ability to construct a Feitoria, unique to Portugal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +2 [ICON_Production] Production. Trade routes sent to this city from Portugal gain +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. Can only be built adjacent to Luxury or Bonus resources in territory belonging to other Civilizations or City-States that you have Open Borders with. Must be built on a Coast or Lake tile adjacent to land and not adjacent to another Feitoria. Feitorias cannot be removed.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Golf Course, unique to Scotland.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenities and +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if adjacent to a City Center district and +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if adjacent to an Entertainment Complex district. Additional [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism and [ICON_HOUSING] Housing as you advance through the Civics and Technology Tree. Cannot be placed on Desert or Desert Hills. One per city. Tiles with Golf Courses cannot be swapped. +1 Appeal.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Mission, unique to Spain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and +1 [ICON_Food] Food if on a different continent than your [ICON_Capital] Capital. +1 [ICON_Science] Science for every adjacent Campus and Holy Site district. Additional [ICON_SCIENCE] Science once Cultural Heritage is discovered. +2 Loyalty per turn for cities with a Mission improvement adjacent to the City Center and not on your original [ICON_Capital] Capital's continent.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct an Open-Air Museum, unique to Sweden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 Appeal. +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism for each type of terrain (Snow, Tundra, Desert, Plains or Grassland) in which at least one Swedish city is founded. One per city. Tiles with Open-Air Museums cannot be swapped.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Kurgan, unique to Scythia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith. +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold if adjacent to a Pasture. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for each adjacent Pasture (becomes +2 after researching Stirrups). Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from [ICON_FAITH] Faith after researching Flight. Cannot be built on Hills.

Does not cost a charge, but does cost 1 [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron and 1 [ICON_RESOURCE_COAL] Coal. Greatly improves [ICON_Movement] Movement speed of any unit moving from one Railroad tile to another. [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes traveling over Railroads can multiply the [ICON_Gold] Gold they get from districts at their destination.
Chinese unique Medieval era unit that replaces the Crossbowman. Ranged unit with high combat strength.
All districts receive an standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district.

A district unique to Greece for cultural sites. Replaces the Theater Square district and cheaper to build. Awards 1 [ICON_Envoy] Envoy when completed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{LOC_DISTRICT_THEATER_APPEAL_DESCRIPTION} +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus for each adjacent district and an additional +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus for adjacent City Center. +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus for each adjacent wonder, Entertainment Complex, and Water Park. Can only be built on Hills.
